data.title: Small Tex Mex
data.text: My son and I stopped in after school to get something to eat. There weren't as many choices as I had hoped for. Neither of us were very impressed with the food. We got our food to go as the place is tiny and it wasn't as neat as I desired. Tables were left with food and plates. I'll choose Taco Bell over this next time.

data.title: Incredible
data.text:
Delicious and fresh ! Tasty and abundant . 
Friendly staff and extremely clean .
The fajitas were very tasty . 
Will definitely be back

data.title: Simply delicious
data.text:
Driving home from work I passed by and noticed the name and thought very cleaver name ! 
I stopped in since quesadillas are my favorite . 
Boy was it RICO!! 
Awesome atmosphere , young crowd , friendly staff .
The food fresh and served really nicely .
Very clean restaurant .
Will definitely be back perhaps next time for some RICO fajitas !

data.title: Unexpected pleasure
data.text: My son and I stopped in for a bite to eat after visiting Nova university,  A man greeted us who I thought was the owner,  it turned out he said he was the Marketing Manager (he told me his name but I didn't catch it).  His welcome was much appreciated after a busy day and he reccommended a few dishes (we ordered the cheese enchiladas, which were delish).  In thsession times of rude service, this guy was a breath of fresh air and made the experience first rate!

data.title: What a mess
data.text: My wife and I had lunch here today after church and I'm not sure how they are still in business. First of all this place is a copy cat of Zona Fresca. We were in the area and saw the restaurant from University Drive and decided to give it a try. Wow, what a mistake. First of all we walked in and all the tables were not clean. Then when we ordered, the girl that took our order seemed very annoyed. Then the food took forever to come out. And lastly when the food did finally come out the girl behind the counter kind of threw the plates on our table and had an attitude. I ordered the grilled steak burritto, which was mediocre at best. And my wife ordered the garden bowl. It was terrible and she could not even finish it. Do not go to this restaurant. The food is bad, the service is bad, and the place is a mess. We will never step foot in this restaurant again.

data.title: Family dinner
data.text: The meal was a bit of a disappointment. The sauces were off the portions were not what I expected for the prices that I paid. The entire meal was off and the Tex-mex side of the equation was not present.

data.title: Fresh Mahi Mahi
data.text:
Our friends recommend Taco Rico so I stopped in for lunch with my wife.  

We were greeted as soon as we walked in and the dining area was clean.  After reviewing the menu I went for the 3 Mahi Tacos with re-fried beans and rice.  The wife had two tacos.  Complimentary chips were provided and our food came out in a timely manner.

The Mahi Tacos came with plenty of Mahi Mahi and had a good taste and was fresh.  There was nothing over the top. Just another average restaurant.

If your in the area looking for tacos give it a try.......

data.title: Rip Off
data.text: We were having a hard time locating a Mexican restaurant in this area as we are used to outrageous food from the state of N.C. We saw Taco Rico and pulled in keeping our fingers crossed..How bad could it be right?? When the order for the fajita platter arrived we were stunned to see the portion for $18.00 ..We were lucky to count 8 small pieces of chicken for two served with 10 tortillas..makes a lot of sense. so, so disappointed...They should check out Papa's & Beer's web site to see how it is done..Totally plain tasting as well. Oh well, the hunt continues..

data.title: SOSO
data.text: I found the food to be very bland and watery.  The red sauce on the enchilada was like a watered down ketchup as actually described by someone at the next table.  I like my food moist but not this moist.  I ordered a Taco and Enchilada lunch special for $5.99. This is not Tex Mex food as I know it.  It lacked seasoning.  Perhaps kids would enjoy this food.  The medium pico de gallo was not spicy at all.  My girlfriend said her pico de gallo was spicy and I had given her the mild.  She had the 3 Taco Platter for $5.99 and the beans were very runny.  I do not plan on going back because it was just food.  Nothing special.  I was looking for a new Mexican Restaurant but this is not the one that pleases my palette. With two soft drinks plus tax the total check was $16.49.  The staff was friendly and even spoke to us on the way out which I liked.  The restroom was as clean as could be expected.  Improve the sauce on the enchiladas, drain the liquid off the plate, add taco seasoning and you should get a better dish.  Otherwise it is just food.

data.title: Fresh and Delicious
data.text:
In this place orders are taken at the counter and made fresh to order. Many menu choices are available. I chose the chicken taco salad. A good size basket was given to me along with a glass for self-serve drinks. A numbered marker was also provided. The entre is served after you sit down. There is a salsa bar with several sauces; green, red, hot and mild, chunky and one other were all there. Each was fresh and tasty. The salad came in a fried flour taco shell inside a much larger white ceramic salad bowl. Metal silverware was nice too. The salad was good, with lots of ingredients. Black beans and corn and sour cream, plus really good guacamole and shredded real cheese made the salad interesting. The grilled, chopped chicken had a nice marinated taste. The chicken was chopped a bit small for my liking. For under $8 including the chips and salsa it is a good value. 
I will eat here again for sure.

data.title: Many Items to Choose From Food Made To Order
data.text: Convenient location average eats,good service. Place was clean food was served hot. I visited at lunch they do have a specials at reduced cost for lunch. Salsa was GOOD!

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Good food. Not a long wait. I'm not sure the tortilla chips are made fresh, here, but the salsa is delicious. This place is similar to Tijuana Flats but this atmosphere is calmer. Football game on, too!

data.title: A pesar de ser comida rapida, es casera y muy fresca.
data.text:
La atención es muy buena, es un lugar de comida rapida, pero todos los ingredientes se notaban eran muy frescos.
Pedi una sopa de calabaza y se ha convertido en mi favorita, realmente buena.
Comi también una ración de tacos de pollo, riquisimos!!
El lugar es agradable, queda en una esquina en un plaza, es bastante iluminado y limpio.
Finalmente comida mexicana rapida, casera y de calidad!!
